item.title: VCS
item.description: In software engineering, version control (also known as **revision control, source control, **or source code management) is class of systems responsible for managing changes to computers programs, documents, large websites, or other collections of information. Changes are usually identified by a number or letter code termed as “revision number”. Source-management models Traditional VCS uses a centralized model where all revision control function take place on a shared server. Centralized VCS solves problem of overwriting of code by two programmers by using one of two different “source-management models” : file locking and version merging.
